data.title: DPH Services: Birth and Death Records
data.meta_description: This page provides information about how to obtain birth, death and marriage certificates.
data.text:
Obtaining Records In-Person, by Mail or

Online

Order In-Person

Individuals can order in person at any of three locations around the state. All locations are open for customer service Mondays to Fridays from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. except on holidays.

OVS, New Castle County

258 Chapman Road, Newark, DE 19702

P: 302-283-7130

F: 302-283-7131

OVS, Kent County (Central office)

417 Federal St., Dover, DE 19901

P: 302-744-4549

F: 302-736-1862

OVS, Sussex County

546 S. Bedford St., Georgetown, DE 19947

P: 302-515-3190

F: 302-515-3191

Order Online

Application Forms for Vital Records

The Office of Vital Statistics encourages individuals to mail in requests for vital records certificates. Complete the appropriate form and mail it to the Office of Vital Statistics located in the Jesse S. Cooper Building in Dover (see address on the form)

Birth Certificate

Adoptee’s Birth Certificate

Same-Gender Marriage Certificate

Death Certificate

Death Certificate for Funeral Directors

Marriage Certificate

Legal Requests

Legal requests from authorized representatives must use the OVS legal template, be on official letterhead, and state the purpose of the request. If the applicant is an authorized representative of a client other than the registrant, the applicant must explain how the vital record will be used, demonstrate the client’s relationship to the registrant (e.g., attach documents that show a relationship such as birth or marriage certificates, Register of Wills Short Certificate/Form 6, and/or court order), and state the law/regulation(s) that makes the applicant eligible to receive the requested vital record.

Gender Re-Assignment Packet

Required Documents for Gender Re-assignment

Requester’s Affidavit

Healthcare Provider’s Affidavit

Baby's Background

Having a baby? Answer post delivery questions now by using:

Baby’s Background, a sister company of GoCertificates.com, Inc. was created to allow parents to answer post-birth hospital questions at their convenience, rather than directly after birth, while also offering the option to pre-order birth certificates. Otherwise, birth certificates and related documents can be ordered for yourself, your child, or for qualifying family members. Baby’s Background can be accessed by clicking the link above or by going to www.babysbackground.com.

Heirloom Birth Certificates

Several years ago, this office began issuing heirloom birth certificates. The heirloom birth certificates are printed on specially designed security papers.

Helpful Link

Delaware State Archives Guide to Vital Records page

Some of the files available on this page are in Microsoft Word format which requires Microsoft Word or Word Viewer. A free copy of Microsoft Word Viewer can be downloaded directly from Microsoft,
